choices: Dorothy decides to try out more gas-inducing food.
Dorothy has to release some leftover gas.
1132121212111212121111112212112122211112.content:
Dorothy's stomach growled like a monster. You took a couple steps back, fearing what was to come. Apparently, her 20th Century rural body was not adjusting very well to the 21st Century urban delicacies that she had just consumed. The farm girl could feel a torrent of gas whirling inside her abdomen, causing it to bloat outward slightly. Then, it shifted up her chest. The brunette clasped her right hand over her mouth, attempting to hold in the surging air. However, the maelstrom that tunneled through her esophagus was too powerful to be contained. Her cheeks puffed out before the gas literally pushed her lips apart, blowing her hand away from her face in the process.

~*BBBUURRRRRPPP!*~

An uncouth burp erupted from the polite little girl. It rang through the air, sounding akin to a feral roar that made you plug your ears. Scents of partially-digested soda, a frankfurter slathered in ketchup, yellow mustard, relish, chili, white onion, sauerkraut, celery salt, pepper and shredded cheese (she was really hungry), and acidic stomach gas were expelled from her body, morphing into a faintly green cloud. Close passersby heard the gaseous explosion and turned their heads toward the two of you. You hated the unwanted attention, and are somewhat relieved when they disgustedly covered up their noses after taking a whiff of Dorothy’s beastly belch and quickly departed. For three unbelievable seconds, the epic eructation made her flamingo pink lips quake, until it finally fades. Dorothy once again shielded her mouth with her hand, but it was out of embarrassment this time. A deep crimson tint lit up her face, making her look even cuter than before.

“Oh dear… Excuse me!” She apologized.

You just stood there for a moment, trying to register what happened. After a few seconds, you snapped out of it, removed your hands from your ears and pinch your nose with your left hand, using your right to fan away the lingering fragrance of Dorothy’s burp. You approached her and wrapped a comforting arm around her shoulder.

“Don’t be sorry,” You said. “It’s okay.”

Dorothy turned to you. “Really? That was very unladylike.”

“It’s your day. You’re allowed to act differently if you want,” You assure her. “Besides, it was kind of funny watching those people’s reactions.”

Dorothy takes a moment to think about it and giggled. “Alright, you may have a point, but doesn’t the smell bother you?”

“Yeah, but it’s not too bad.” You replied. “In fact, I wouldn’t mind if you did that more.”

Dorothy’s blush reddened further, making her resemble a tomato. “Well, if that’s the case…”

113212121211121212111111221211212221112.content:
Dorothy grabs your hand and pulls you to the roller coaster.
You were a little surprised, you didn't think someone like Dorothy would like fast rides, but she is clearly eager and this is meant to be her day after all. If she wants the roller coaster, then that is where you will go.

The track of the rollercoaster is a long one, with plenty of rises and dips, and a fair share of right turns. You feel sure the ride is not one that will be over quickly.

There is a small queue, but when you get to the front of it, the two of you manage to get a seat to yourselves. She encourages you to take a seat first, then she joins you, sitting down next to you, particularly close you notice. You wonder why she was so insistent that you got on first, and why she is sitting so close you can feel her body touching you but you have no reason to suspect any sort of ulterior motive.

One of the attendants puts the safety barrier down just before the ride starts up, and you notice that although the barrier will keep you safely in your seats, it does not prevent any side-to-side motion upon the seat. Dorothy notices this too, and it pleases her for some reason.

The ride starts, slowly at first but quickly picking up speed, and then you come to the first of the right turns. As the ride turns, at the speed it is travelling, you and Dorothy are both pressed to the right, only the edge of the seat prevents you from moving any further. Dorothy however is pressed against your side, squashing you against the seat as you turn.

"Yes!" she exults as she feels the effect? Was this her plan all along.

"So that was your plan then?" you jokingly smile at her.

"You should feel lucky!" she replies "if it wasn't for the barrier I'd be sitting on you right now."

"You can sit on me if you want." you point out, it is her day after all.

"Not now, silly... the barrier, remember. For now I'll just have to make you nice and squished."

As she says that, another right turn comes up and yourself being squashed once more. Curiously, each time she gets closer, she makes no move to move back afterwards. After several turns, you feel that Dorothy is firmly grinding herself into your side, your hip starts to ache.

There are many rises and falls, and you and Dorothy both love those, but it seems that it is those right turns that particularly please her.

When the ridge comes to an end.

"Goodness, those bananas look tasty." When the farmer saw her, he immediately knew what she was after and tried to get his horse to move faster. The horse galloped away as fast as it could go, however, Alice wasn't about to give up. She jogged after it and picked up the cart with her left hand. She dumped all of the bananas into her mouth enjoying their creamy taste. The farmer yelled at her but realizing he couldn't do anything about it simply and rode his horse back to town. "Oh dear I'm so terribly sorry sir but they were delicious though." Alice said, calling after him.

She slowly followed him back to town. She looked around and saw a bucket of vegetables. She dumped them in and swallowed. Everybody stared up at her in horror. 11422221121.content:
You followed the fanged student's footsteps, each wide enough to cross one of Gatlin's cornfields. The sway in her hips made her moth-torn dress flap - sending brief gusts of chilled wind across your body. Or was that just a draft? The miles-high walls looked as if they hadn't been maintained for at least two centuries.

Knowing Sibella's prestigious heritage - why was she walking, not gliding in bat form? Not that you minded. Though the pounds of her gigantic red flats made it seem like they'd tear the worn black-and-white tiles from the creaking floor - and sent you off-balance more than once - you had the feeling that she'd be much harder to pursue in midair. From behind her curtains of messy mauvre hair, it looked as if she was holding something in her arms. Even if her walking speed was breathtaking to you, she kept a slow, measured rhythm to her motions - like a somber dirge.

Or a ghoul carrying something fragile.

Carefully, she reached over the doorknob. It seemed to complain a bit as she pulled it back; you took the moment to break into a sprint, nearing Sibella. In a flash of purple, and with a groan of old hinges, the vampire slid inside. The door shut in your face, knocking you back almost to the end of the hall. How much strength was in those delicate, lavender arms?

Thankfully, the decaying architecture worked to your advantage. You swoonced in through a hole in the wood. On the other side lay Sibella's dorm room.

How to describe it? To anyone else, the dimly-lit room would seem cramped and claustrophobic; but at your height, the vampire's living area stretched amazingly far and high. Seeing the halls was one thing; knowing that the bookshelf and table towering above you you were actually things that Sibella used everyday was unbelievable. Huge clumps of dust lay around you, clinging to your soles as you entered cautiously. By the breaks in the wall and accumulated dirt, you would guess that this room were abandoned, if you hadn't seen the monster of a girl entering just a second ago. At the same time, there was a sense of order to its disarray - the torn tablecloths spread out neatly, all of the ancient tomes of madness ordered carefully.

And in the center of the room, upon a wobbly chair, Sibella rested. She was rested over a bowl several times your size, stirring with an old wooden spoon. At her scale, it was hard to think of her as a living person - she was like another landmark in the fields of dust before you. In fact, you weren't sure if she'd even qualify as "living" at full size, but that was beyond the point.

An open book dangled on the edge of the table. You saw the title: Guide to Home Eeek-onomics. Despite your calls, the enormous vampire kept focused on the contents of the bowl - only occasionally peeking to the yellowed pages. Leafing across one with a slender finger, she spoke out loud:

"Insert cream of scream, blood orange, stir until slimy... I hope everyone likes this goulash."

So, that was what was in the bowl. A little off, but nothing bone-shakingly terrifying. Knowing that she was so careful with the food, and preparing it for friends, actually renewed your will to get closer.

You stepped forward, and immediately regretted it.

A cobweb was strung across the floor, its silky threads embracing your leg. The dim lighting had hidden the sticky trap until you were right in it!

In the shifting shadows of Sibella's stirring, you couldn't tell what was in the distance. You thought you could see legs moving, about to pounce on you. Every little wind that touched the webbing shook you to the core. Your muscles tensed up, ready for a spider to appear from the shadows... And nothing.

You yelped, tugging away at your trapped leg.

"My, look what the bat dragged in." The smooth voice slid out from above, piercing into you.

You saw the delicate curve of the woman's immense palm overtaking you. Her green eyes stared in your direction. Finally! Sibella noticed you! You felt the threads from the web lift upwards as she grasped them, pulling up with a gentleness remarkable for such an overpowering creature.

"I needed more webs for texture. This will be fangtastic!"

Your hopes sunk faster than a ship hitting an iceberg. In an instant, she dropped you into the bowl. A foul-smelling substance clung to your body. Whenever you tried to wipe them off, more of the viscous brew clung to your arms. It weighed you down, making it impossible to climb out. Whenever you opened your mouth to shout again, sickening fumes rushed into it.

And Sibella kept stirring. You were caught in a whirlpool of what could only really qualify as "food" through a twisted, inhuman lens. Struggling against the tide did nothing to help.

Suddenly, you felt the ground lift from under you. Still unable to move, you found yourself staring up at Sibella's glance - blue eyelids half-hiding the immense eyeballs. They came closer. She was lifting the spoon up, moving it towards her mouth.

"Just a little taste test, before anyone else sinks their teeth in..."

The girl opened her mouth wide. You could only see a dark chasm past the sharp fangs, glistening gently in the moonlight. Higher and higher, you saw more details of her mouth. A thin pool of saliva forming under her pink tongue, building in anticipation. Perfectly-straight rows of teeth, all ready to suck your life away. You could practically feel her breath now - cool like a night breeze. It made you shake and shiver. The spoon tilted underneath you, and you felt as if you'd slide right in...

To be swallowed by a cartoon character... how did you reach this point in life?
11422221121.title: Sibella's Room

114222211212.content:
You thrashed in the spoon, but the thick goulash weighed down your tiny arms. Struggling for attention just left you panting, legs sinking deeper into the warm, murky brew. Teensy droplets of it fell from the concave wood, down to the distant floor below - at the base of Sibella's dress, draping across her mountainous figure. Her hips swayed like majestic sea waves, ready to drown you.

Soon, you'd just be fat on those hips.

"Mmmn... I can't wait to sink my fangs in!" Her voice chilled you, shaking the mixture. The woman's wet tongue peeked out from its cave, a monster emerging from the darkness. The slimy muscle traversed her blood-red lips and snow-white teeth. They both shimmered in the pale moonlight, reflecting the ancient, cobweb-kissed walls. Your own reflection peered back in the smooth ruby pillows; and the sheer difference in scale shocked you. The gigantic orange slices and cobwebs surrounding you were bad enough. Seeing yourself floating in the mix, suspended in a canopy high above ground level, as the ghoul student uses only her index and thumb to hold the handle... You felt your hope draining, and your blood rushing, as if a vampire were sucking you dry.

The vampire held your life in a kitchen utensil... And she didn't even see you!

Finally, with a bone-chilling slosh, her jaw opened wide. She thrust the utensil right into the gaping bat-cave, with you on it. Darkness draped the organic walls. You tried climbing out, but there was nothing but pink organs everywhere. Past her luscious lips. Over her pink gums. The air grew sticky and humid. An ominous coldness floated in it. Your puny struggles grew weaker. The vampire's mouth became your sky, your floor, your whole realm.

With a wet slurp, her jaw closed off the last remnants of light. Intense suction tugged at you - messing up you hair, sending ingredients splashing across your shirt, and finally pulling your body off the spoon. You clutched for the wood again, but it the mighty tongue suplexed you. Your last chance for escape slid out past her teeth, and out of grasp. Floods of saliva splashed you away - you sunk in them, feeling leaving your nerves.

The dark confines of Sibella's maw had you trapped!

"Ahh..." Your captor's pensive voice rang from below. You expected to hear more - hungry groans from her digestive track, the low pulse of blood through her veins. But her internal organs were inhumanly still, as if she didn't need them to survive. It left you in eerie silence, broken by naught but the echo of your own racing heart, and the splash of her moving saliva.

The organ slithered around you, taking in the texture of your goosebumped skin. You tried to punch back; but it was so covered in thick, translucent liquid, that your minuscule fist simply slid off. The massive tongue constricted you so tightly that merely twitching was painful.

Plop. A bit of the cobweb descended to her throat, swept in by cold waves of salivation.

Her chomping teeth ground other ingredients - ones bigger than you - to mush. Juice from it splashed on your face. You tried diving away from the terrifically sharp fangs, but she held you in place subconsciously.

A sudden jerk from the constraining organ snapped you from your petrified daze. It pushed you easily across the organic chasm. You were flying and falling at the same time. In the shadows, you could see the shimmer of her molars.

Immediately, Sibella squeezed you into her cheek. The surface receded easily against your shrunken frame. From every side, pulsating muscle and flowing wetness surrounded you. She'd also licked some blood orange from the spoon, which splattered across your torso. The student's taste buds roughly brushed up and down your spine, lathering you in even more drool. From all your thrashing, you'd gotten some of the strange brew's flavor on you. Though it smelt terrifying to a human, this vampire indulged in it. She explored and savored every little corner of your body, steadily jostling it side to side.

Gulp. The orange slice slipped past her dangling uvula. You squirmed at the slick sound it made in her esophagus. There was only one more ingredient from the ghoulish goulash still in her mouth...

You.

The tongue's tortuous touch released. You dropped onto the slimy platform, drenched in misty, cool saliva. Despite your exhaustion from the harrowing experience, you had enough strength to stand up... Though the wet, squishy floor made you slip to your knees. It wobbled with each clumsy step you took. Amid the silence, you could hear tiny giggles from below, within the woman's depths.

You'd stumbled as far away from the sloshing noises as possible. You made it to the tip of the surface right near Sibella's gums. From the continual motion, it seemed like she was stirring the bowl again. The slightest flick of her wrist jostled you. She hummed a haunting tune, quaking through her lips and to your chilly bones.

A wall of teeth stood before you, pale and flawless. These incisors were all that kept you from the outside world, the Ghoul School's halls, freedom. Both your fists pounded on them, the reverberations echoing through the enamel. They *had* to open. She *had* to pull you out. You wailed away, until your knuckles grew blistered and weary, and sweat coated your neck.

Not a budge.

The scarlet carpet beneath you tipped up, tripping you backwards. You reached out for something to hold - but the pink roof of Sibella's mouth was far out of your grasp, a sky in itself. The water slide of a tongue welcomed you down, tilting vertically. Gravity twisted at the command of the soft muscle, spinning your world.

Gulp

The sloshing sound burned your ears. She swallowed! The vampire's esophagus pulled you in head-first. Broken by your struggles in her jaw, you found yourself unable to resist the masticating tunnel. With a steady, rhythmic pulsation, it tugged you deeper into her towering form - further from escape. You felt as if her entire throat was intricately probing you, from head to toe. Sometimes, the muscles closed in tight enough to strangle you; only for the next throb to release you, letting its tiny passenger slide closer to the destination.

And, at last, it came into view. From an organic aperture, a murky wind. Gently swaying, opaque waters lay dozens of meters below, bearing the ruins of the vampire's prior taste tests. Slowly, the tight contractions loosened. The valve welcomed you into the pulsating room - in reality, a belly.

Plop.

Instantly, you felt acids eating at your scalp, crawling up yo your face, and then your neck. By the time you pulled your head out of the acidic lake, you were already drenched in the undead woman's fluids. You swam for dry land. But the sway of her hips as she stirred her bowl created sweeping tidal waves, which swallowed you again and again.

The pull on your arms grew heavier. You sunk deeper and deeper, touching the spongy seafloor. After being tossed to and fro so much by this cartoon character's mouth, and twisted by her esophagus, this felt more manageable. The faraway stomach walls slowly vibrated; you didn't feel cramped. Her gut was still, and quiet, giving you time to take large breaths. The air itself was heavy, but cool - like being in a forest at night. A strange sense of relief washed over you.

It was peaceful. You'd be able to think of an escape plan.

Feeling left your fingers and toes. The rose and yellow-green colours slipped out of view, to darkness. But you'd find a way out. After a moment to rebuild your strength...

The slow sway of the internal world rocked you. Sounds of low humming faded into the distance. You could get out. Or at least, you'd be part of someone nice - someone far bigger, someone encompassing your entire world...

As you gave yourself up, the enzymes welcomed the extra meat and blood. Not a hint of panic remained as your last bit of consciousness fell, leaving you floating loosely within Sibella's full stomach.

You were digested.

---

The spoon stopped moving.

Sibella stood still, admiring her work. She put a hand to her hip, and licked her lips. A sense of fullness rushed through her belly.

"This ghoulash tastes fangtastic! I can think of a certain teacher and his dog who might like a bowl..." She giggled. "And I'm sure it'll be a scream with the girls, too!"
114222211212.title: Sibella's Succulent Slurp

You stood at the window of your room, watching as the stars came out. Behind you, the last credits of your favorite movie were playing on your TV, Little Nemo. Since you had turned ten you had loved the movie; you'd gotten a posted of it from your aunt the year before as a Christmas present and tacked it up over your bed. Every time you saw a shooting star you wished that you could travel to Slumberland just like Nemo and go on an adventure plus you had a crush on the beautiful Princess Camille.

"Aaron, time for bed!" Your mom calls through the door.

"Ok," you reply. Turning off your TV you listen to your parents close the door to their room as you tug on your white pajamas. As you bring the comforter up to your neck you turn to look out the window and up into the night until you feel your eyes getting heavy.

...

You wake up slowly, seeing it's still nighttime. A noise, faint like rushing water catches your attention. As quietly as you can you tip toe down the cold floor of the hallway to the bathroom. If your little sister left the water running in the sink she'll try and blame you like always.

The nose stops just as you reach the door, but the light is off and no other sounds are audible. "Sarah, are you in there?" You whisper. No on answers. "I'm opening the door," you warn. Slowly you swing the door inward, revealing an empty bathroom. "What the what?" You ask yourself. You knew you had heard water running, but no one could have snuck past you. "Maybe I'm dreaming, just like Nemo," you giggle. As you turn to leave the sound returns, and this time you're shocked to see running water somehow behind the mirror. Hesitantly you press your hand against the glass. "This is weird," you smile. Your smile vanishes when you try an pull your hand away but find it stuck. You pull harder, but the glass is like glue. Then something pulls you forward, your feet slipping on the rug and giving you no resistance as you are dragged through the mirrored surface.

For what is either a few seconds or hours, you fall down a raging waterfall. Sights pass by the tube you seem to be in, many too fast for you to get a look at. Finally you see a large pool below you and brace yourself for impact. As you hit the surface you sink fast, the surface fading from view. Strangely you can still breath, and soon you see the bottom. Just before you hit it though, your vision fades and you black out. When you open your eyes again, you find yourself in a room you easily recognize as....

115221.content:
Robyn Starling,a very pretty and intelligence girl of 8 years old was having another tough day, she had just been on the receiving end of one of her abusive aunt's cruelty and taunting about how her father,a famous pilot was apparently dead and she was her only guardian and she had to run before the bloated purple dressed bean bag could yell at her to come back and set the dining room table. She had decided to go over to the park to do the only thing she could do when her aunt smirked and endlessly belated her.

Later that night back in her small room at the top staircase the short haired blonde began to cry as she glanced down at herself while pulling out her small golden locket,the only thing she had left of her father,only just now noticing just how badly hungry she was. While her Aunt Figg thankfully wasn't truly physically violence(this was a kids' cartoon after all!),she was stone cold to her supposed niece and despise having a huge buffet of food especially both for herself and her equally plump dog,she only gave the girl mere table scraps and Robyn of all things was forced to steal food in order to survive a simple night.

Her spirit was broken and her clothes were much worse for wear, Her headband had been broken in half when the beating had began leaving her hair disheveled and unkempt, her shirt and pants had been ripped and torn in many places from her aunt pulling at her as she attempted to and failed to get away..

Robyn sighed as she glanced up at the dark cloud filled sky, "At least it's not raining.."

No sooner had she said that did it begin to rain. "Oh come on! *sob sob*" That was the last straw for Robyn, not being able to stop her self she began to weep, hot tears fell from her face along with the cold rain drops pelting her as she shouted to her self "WHY WAS I THE ONE WHO HAD TO BE GIVEN SUCH A CRUEL AUNT!?!"

Thinking no one heard her she continued to cry wincing ever once in a while, as a tear or raindrop fell into her already wrinkled red shirt with the thin white stripe on her body. However unbeknownst to Robyn someone HAD heard her earlier outburst and was coming over to check on her.

"Excuse me child, are you okay?"

"Ohhh W-Who said that? Huh?" As the young girl jumped with a start as she struggled to make out the owner of the voice before her, until she noticed the person in font was actually an old man! he was clad in a black raincoat and had an umbrella in his left hand while he held onto a cane he had in front of him with his right.

"Who are you?" Robyn asked quickly wiping away her tears with the back of her hand, the man smiled happy to see that he had her attention. "I'm William my dear. but you can call me Will.." He said trailing off as he noticed the state the child was in.

"Hello I-I'm Robyn,Robyn Starling. H-how did you get in my aunt's house?"

"Ohh I have my ways my dear Robyn..For you see, I'm no ordinary man...." He replied smirking putting up his umbrella.

"Huh? What's that supposed to mean?" As she quickly stood up as he offered his hand to her.

" Just take a hold of my hand and you'll no longer have yo see this horrible place...it's perfectly alright my dear no harm will come to you." He said kindly.

Robyn stayed silent for a moment before she said.

" Well normally both my father and A-Aunt Figg always told me to never talk or go anywhere with strangers...but you do seem like a very nice man so...yes...I accept. Anywhere's better than here." As she tenderly took his hand and he led her to the door.

Will smiled as he nodded saying "Nice to meet you Robyn.." He expected the child to say something instead she stayed quiet but watched astonished as the man took out a really thin stick,gave it a wave then both of then vanished into thin air!

"You seem cold, and lonely might I add. Would like for me to sit with you?" Robyn glanced down at the wooden bench in the isolated park she was currently sitting on in amazement then to the man in front of her.

"H-how did you do all that? A-are you a...." She gibberish unable to finish as he nodded.

"Yes my dear,I am indeed a magician or a wizard if you will. I practice magic but very good magic not evil."

"Magic? So you can do spells and things like that?" The girl's jaw dropped open as she took a step back in shock as Will nodded and went about siin the bench leaving the umbrella open over him and Robyn to keep the rain off the two of them. "So ,Robyn if you don't mind me prying who did this to you?" He asked wanting to know her full story, Robyn glanced down at her feet barely covered by her shoes and socks which looked to be about in tatters.

"My cruel Aunt Figg,but she's not really my aunt,only my guardian..." Robyn finally said with a sniff as she carefully explained everything to the strange old man finally Will nodded with a somber expression, "I feared as much.."
Robyn quickly asked "Can you help me?!"
"Help?" Will repeated wanting her to explain.
"Yeah! Can you do something? Take my Aunt somewhere so she can't get too me or maybe even send me somewhere?"
Will blinked before he smiled "I may be able to do just that Robyn.."

Robyn looked at her new friend in confusion, "What do you mean?"

Will laughed, "Let me explain.." He said as he brought up his cane which upon closer inspection was actually a magic wand! "I'm not just an old man, I also know powerful magic, like being able too send someone or something somewhere else.."

As the girl took a moment to process what she had been told before her eyes widened in realization, "You mean you could.."
Will nodded somberly. "Yes I can do this for you.."

Robyn began to squeal and bounce up and down saying "Thank you! Thank you sir!!" Over and over before Will spoke again.

"I'll send us too the town I'm from but only if you do something for me.."

Robyn quickly nodded saying "Anything just name it!"

"I have a grandson the same age as you named Miles. I want you to be his friend for me. Can you do that?"

Robyn nodded within seconds before she said.

"Yes of course! I'll be happy too!"

With that Will chanted a spell and in a flash of light he and Robyn disappeared.

A moment later they reappeared in front of a small house on top of a hill, overlooking a small town. "Where are we?" Robyn asked in wonder,

Will turned to the house saying "We're in the town I grew up in that is my home.." He said trailing off as he went too open the door, "Come my grandson is expecting us."

With that the two of them went in before they were greeted by a small boy with light brown hair.

"Grandpa!" The boy shouted in glee as he wrapped the older man in a hug, "Did you enjoy your trip?"
Will nodded and said. "Yes I did and I brought a friend for you."

"Really who?" The boy asked before his sight landed on Robyn, he blushed "Hi, I'm Miles. What's your name?"

Robyn blushed in return and said Hello I'm Robyn."

With the introductions out of the way, Miles quickly turned to his grandpa, "Hey grandpa, Can I go practice my magic with Robyn?"

Will nodded saying "I don't see why not just be careful okay?"

With that the two ran outside shouting "We will!" However while the two were outside..

1152211.content:
Miles was attempting to pronounce one of the more advanced spells in the spell book his father had given him just two years ago when he had first learned that he could use magic, however he seemed to be having trouble. "Do you want some help?" Robyn asked as she curiously stood over him trying to be nice, Miles was about to retort that he didn't need help from a girl before he remembered all the times that his grandpa had taught him about manners and too always be nice to girls so he decided to say "Yes actually, Can you help me figure out what this says?"

Robyn then took a quick look at the page Miles had been trying to reed and said. "Hmmm.... Well I-I think it says Giantess Maximus. Make anyone a giant with this spell and simply say the spell again to turn the giant back to normal." The pretty eight year old forgetting about her evil aunt,missing father and virtually everything else gushed as she finished reading the page's spell, "Wow! S-So this magic stuff is f-for real?"

Miles glanced at his wand as he asked aloud "I wonder if it will work?" Robyn eyed him curiously, "You mean you've never tried it not even on a harmless animal?"
Miles shrugged as sweat dropped from his foreheadas he retorted. "Uh no because most animals won't be so harmless if they turn into a giant.."

Robyn blushed at that and said "Oh that's true hehe sorry. Well how's a good time as any to try it out don't you think?"
However Miles just brushed it off saying "Don't worry about it.."
The two stayed quiet for a moment before another question came to mind, "W-Who's gonna test it?" Miles asked suddenly,
Robyn thought about it and said a bit slyly feeling a tad braver.
"Say Miles I-I think you should use it on me."
Miles blushed a bit at the sudden decision as he voiced his concern, "Y-You? Bull.but..are you sure Robyn? You're just a little girl....I mean what if something goes wrong? Like what if you grow but your clothes-"

He asked before he cut himself off to stop himself from saying something embarrassing, however Robyn knew what he was getting at and blushed bright red looking off to the side in a shy manner. "Ohh it will be perfectly alright Miles! I mean you are a very talented young wizard aren't you? *Giggle* I have complete faith in you!" She muttered making Miles squirm in an embarrassed manner, after the awkward exchange the two children got their nerves under control.
Miles was the one that broke the silence as he said "Okay I'll recite the spell let me know if anything happens!"

Robyn nodded and said "okay!" Taking a moment to steel him self, Miles waved his wand in the air with a shout of "Giantess Maximus!"
The moment he said it his wand blasted off a green beam that hit Robyn square in the stomach area of her bright red with the small white striped shirt,

"Huh...Miles...Offffffffff!" She moaned,after the beam hit Robyn fell to her knees as she felt a large rumble emit from her belly before it began to expand, soon her arms and hands fallowed as well as her legs and feet.

"W-What's happening......Ohhhhh! I-It's Working!" Before long,the young girl's entire body had expanded until she was the size of a building! , "GASP!! I-It worked Miles! I'M A GIANT! Ohhhh but this is weird!" Robyn said before another rumble came from her however this time it was a rumble of hunger. "Uh oh!" Escaped her pretty red lips as she quickly clutched it.

"Sounds like you're pretty hungry." Miles said nervously,

Robyn giggled a cute one and replied lowly as she stood to her full terrifying height of 50 Feet.

"Yeah but don't worry Miles, I won't eat you." As she gave him a sweet smile
Miles nodded and said looking up at the young giantess. "Right how about I poof up something for you to eat? And we teleport to somewhere more open!" Miles asked getting a nod from his friend, "Okay let's see.." Miles looked through his spell book before he instantly transported him and the young giant girl to a small crowded town in the middle of nowhere.

"What are we...." Robyn began before she looked around at dozens of tiny doll sized people on the ground and instantly blushed.

"Er hello..p-please don't be alarmed...I-I won't...."

"Ahhhhh RUN GIANT MONSTER!" As they all ran off and she looked miserably at the boy at her feet Miles just shrugged.

" Well that was to be expected Robyn Starling! What did you think was going to happen? Anyway as long as you take baby steps,nothing should go horribly wrong...let's get you something to eat."

"Sigh...you're right...I just wish everyone wasn't so scared of me!" Robyn muttered lowly as she picked Miles up and put him on her shoulder before she began to carefully walk throughout the tiny town,watching where she was stepping as she actually sniffed around.

"Wait I smell something! *Sniff Sniff* Mmmmm.....Smells like fresh popcorn!" As soon as she said this,she began to go to where the smell was coming from which was a popcorn machine that you would find in a county fair.

"Er Robyn Wait...I-I really don't think that's a good id...." The boy muttered worriedly.
However as Robyn ran over, she accidently stepped on a car crushing it flat under her left sneaker and knocked over a small office building. "Oops I-I'm Sorry!" Robyn shouted clutching a hand over her mouth as people's names the ground began to complain.

"Uh oh, I think we're in trouble." Miles said.

"Darn right you are boy!" A new voice spoke startling the two, on Robyn's other shoulder, stood a man that looked like him but much older.
"Umm hello I-I'm guessing your Miles' father?" Robyn asked nervous, and the man nodded.

"Indeed I am lassie, or Miss Starling, I overheard your little conversation back in our hut yes I'm Markus, Miles' father. Who might you be?" "Robyn sir, it's nice to meet you." She said trying to be polite by bowing however another voice spoke.
"There's no need too be so formal Robyn dear." The voice turned out to be Will whom was floating in the air on a cloud

"M-Mr. Will!" Robyn said with a big smile. Will nodded as he turned to address Miles whom seemed to be shrinking in the presence of both his father and grandfather.

"Now Miles, You should have known better then to use magic so carelessly!" His father said sternly Miles squeaked out.

"Yes Father I promise I won't let it happen again."

Both adults nodded as Will spoke next, "We know you won't. That's why we're letting you off with a warning this time.." He said as without casting a spell he undid all of the damage Robyn had caused moments ago,

Markus then spoke addressing Robyn this time.
"That also means shrinking you down to normal young lady."

Making the young girl sulk a bit. As she slowly nodded.

"Ohhh A-Alright....." She moaned utterly disappointed.

"Ready-!"

However before Markus could cast a spell Robyn stopped him "What? Don't tell me you don't want to be shrunk down little girl?" He asked Robyn thought over his question for a moment before she said...

Markus asked again before Robyn shook her head, "No I'll shrink back down Mr. Markus, I just was so blown away by the fact that magic is so powerful that I wasn't thinking straight is all.." Markus just shook his head in an amused manner before giving her an understanding grin. "I understand the feeling I was just like that when I was my son's age." He said as he wordlessly said the spell making the giant girl shrink down, Robyn just looked between the man and his son in confusion and amazement as she spoke, "Really?"

Miles then stepped up to Robyn and wrapped her in a hug saying, "Yeah, I'm honestly glad dad showed up to stop our hijinks.." He trailed off as he suddenly realized the situation he and Robyn were in and blushed as bright as a tomato, "Point is, I'm just happy your safe." He said looking away shyly. Sporting a blush of her own Robyn asked him "Were you worried about me Miles? *giggle*" Hearing no repose from the boy in question she decided to be a little braver and mess with him a little.

"How sweet of you Miles.." She said before she suddenly leaned over and kissed the boy's cheek making him sputter in embarrassment.

Noticing the exchange Will and Markus shared a laugh as they noticed the flames of a relationship building between the two children before a thought occurred to the adults (Could Robyn be able too use magic as well?) Taking the initiative Markus cleared his throat drawing the kids attention, "Excuse me Robyn, do you mind if I ask you something?" Robyn nodded, "Sure What is it Mr. Markus?" "Do you think you might be able to use magic?"

Robyn's eyes widened in shock for a moment before a thoughtful look crossed her face "I don't know if I can, before today I honestly wasn't sure if magic was real." She said as Miles whom had gotten over his embarrassment earlier placed a hand on her shoulder, "One of your relatives may have been able use magic like your father or maybe even your mother." Miles said trying to be hopeful. Will nodded, "All though with your aunt Figg around I don't blame you for not knowing."

"Do you hate her?" Miles asked curious, "Heavens no, I just wish she could have been a bit nicer too me.." Robyn said with a wishful look in her eye. Markus nodded then before speaking up "Right Now then let's see if you have the ability.." He said as he stood in front of Robyn holding out his wand, within seconds the wand began to blink a green glow slow at first but then it got much faster as Robyn began too glow as well.

"Well that answers that." Markus said as he put his wand away, Robyn just looked confused. "Wait what did you do?" Markus grinned "The spell I just used acts as a magic detector if my wand gives off a red glow that means the person it's pointed to can't use magic but if it glows green.." Robyn gasped as realization came to her "Then that means that I can use magic! Yay!!" She shouted in glee before wrapping Miles in another hug.

Markus then spoke "Hold on now Robyn just because you have ACCESS to magic doesn't mean you know how to USE it."

Seeing where his son was going with this Will spoke next, "Which is why you need these." With a flick of his wand two envelopes poofed into existence. "What are these letters for?" Robyn asked however Miles gave her a look of shock "WHAT?!? You don't know??" Will quickly steeped in to calm his grandson "Calm down Miles my boy, haha! Let me explain."

"Sorry Grandpa." Miles said sheepishly as he rubbed the back of his head, "Now the, the letters I just gave the two of you are invitations to the best magic and wizards school in the country: Garreg Mach Academy." "Wow.." Robyn said in starry eyed amazement. Markus then spoke up adding "The best part though, I'll get to be one of your teachers!"

At that the two children began to bounce in joy before a new voice spoke up "What'd I miss?" Knowing exactly who the voice belonged too Miles shouted "Mom!!!" before wrapping the woman in a hug. "*giggle* I missed you too Miles honey. Oh, hello who's this?" The woman asked noticing Robyn. "Hello Miss, I'm Robyn Sterling." The 8 year old girl said bowing before the woman spoke "There is no need to be so formal with me Robyn.." She trailed of as she held her hand out "I'm Melody Miles' mother. As Robyn greeted the woman she took in her appearance she was a mix between tall and slim with fair skin crystal blue eyes and ginger red hair.

The rest of the day was spent with talking about the academy as well as explaining Robyn's story to Melody, "Oh Robyn, had I known how your aunt treated you I would have done all I could to stop her!" Melody said from her spot at the dinner table. "Melody honey you know as well I do that we can't use our magic on normal people." Markus said from his seat at the head of the table. "I know and I hate that!" Robyn spoke up wanting to change the way the conversation was going, "Thank you for caring but you don't have too do that."

"I hear ol' Will has invited you two to the academy himself?" Melody asked as she turned to give the old man a stern glance, Will nodded, however instead of her praising him she began to scold him, "William Amadeus Wolfgang, as headmaster you know full well that you aren't allowed to play favorites!" However Will just laughed, "I should be the one telling you and my son that!" That shut her up Markus however didn't let it stop there, "He has a point considering Miles will be in my class about magic defence and your broomstick flying class."

That got Markus a pout from his wife and a playful slap on the arm, "Hush you.." "Love you too honey."

After that funny exchange dinner was uneventful, Then Miles and Robyn got ready for bed Miles' mother had made Miles's bed into a bunk bed so they both could share Miles' bed without things being weird. Miles walked into his room after Robyn finished changing into a spare set of his pj's for her to wear as sleepwear. "Looks good on you." Miles said making the girl giggle with a blush on her face, "Thank you."

"Hey Robyn can I ask you a favor?" Robyn nodded, "Sure Miles, What is it?" Miles thought about what he wanted for a moment before he said..

123213.content:
As you looked up to the towering Amazon Princess' head, her attention turned to you, too. The bright eggshell eyes opened wider in concern. Her skyscraper-scale boot tearing the plain as she shifted it away slowly, one hand raising to her lip. A huge purple amulet lay between her fingers.

Suddenly, a gargoyle swept for the gem, about three times your size. The Raven-haired league member, who was even larger, slapped it aside with a quick grunt. She watched it fall to the ground before looking back to you. Diana's concerned gaze turned to frustration, elegantly-shaped eyes narrowing and nose curling up. "Don't stand there, stupid! If you're gonna stare, go with the others where it's safe!"

The others? What did she mean? She pointed a huge index finger behind you, before kicking away another attacking beast. Her boot soared in the air, like a cheerleader's - but with more weight, tossing her whole narrow-but-huge hips into the motion.

You turned back, running out of the fray. In the distance was a whole crowd of children: staring, pointing, and chattering in shock. A few of them cheered or pumped their fists in excitement. Behind them lay a series of castle towers, houses that looked medieval, and classical-style statues.

Even with the bizarre architecture, it was clear that Wonder Woman had grown. You looked to be at normal size, but... When you dashed forward, your legs didn't reach nearly as far as you thought with each gallop.

Fight sounds reigned the air behind you, full of clashes and the occasional deafening stomp. You didn't want to look back - but from the rhythm and feminine-but-booming grunts, it sounded as if the creatures were pushing Wonder Woman closer. Exhaustion tugged at your lungs and legs, and you still hadn't quite reached your destination.

The crowd looked over you, some tykes rushing up to help the home stretch. Their chubby arms grabbed your shoulders.. You panted - then gasped, realizing your voice pitch was much higher. Just like the League in Kid Stuff, your body had been reduced to that of a child!

A boy screamed "Look out!", pointing up.

A huge portion of the children shouted, rushing away. They trampled over you in a desperate frenzy, but something worse was about to come. A set of gargoyles and dragons were beating down on the mountainous superhero, dodging her swings and kicks. You tried to get up, but the dizzying display set you off-balance. One rammed her bare leg - Diana stumbled back. Her boot's heel fell from above, marked with dirt stains, overtaking your body...

FWOOSH

A sudden blur pushed you back. Wonder Woman's sole hit the ground right before your eyes, carving into the pavement with a loud THUMP. The dust lifting from the ground entered your eyes, blinding you. You felt another pair of arms around your back, and couldn't touch the ground. When you opened your eyes, an oddly-familiar smile met you.

Superman, in pint-sized form, had carried you out of harm's way.

"Sorry I'm late! We're all busy with Mordred and his amulet."

He set you onto the ground, in a circle that opened up for him in the crowd. What else could you say, but a bemused "thanks"? He nodded to you, as if understanding the absurdity of the situation.

The crowd members started chattering, a few looking down or away in shame. The young Clark Kent passed his eyes over them with his arms crossed. "Careful. It's good to get away from danger, but you also have to pay attention to other kids. Someone could've been squashed."

A string of apologies with varying levels of sincerity rang out, muffled by the fight sounds. Diana swung and missed a monster, which rammed into her forehead. She fell back into a marble tower, letting out a grunt. Her flat rear end tore the sturdy bricks apart, making the structure crumble onto itself. Some rubble rained down from above...

Before a glowing emerald butterfly net caught them, throwing them back at the flying creatures. Green Lantern shook his head, letting the beam recede back into his ring. "Aww, I did that too quick! I should've made it a cool shield! Or a stunt net! Butterfly nets are girly."

Wonder Woman got back to her legs, feet placed firmly in the ground. One of them crushed a stone monster under it. "Girly's fine by me." She forced a smile, looking down.

The two other league members flew up to help, smashing some of the aerial threats. You noticed a subfuscous figure riding on one's wings, steering it to crash into another it into another. This thing then used a grappling hook to cling to safety on Diana's ear. The amazon tossed herself forward - body-checking the last gargoyles. They collapsed into a spray of rock to the ground, some sediments staying on the yellow mark across her costume. No more of the creatures were in the sky.

She flopped her hair back, a cocky smile pulling her lips as she wiped it off like dust. A few bits fell near you. "That was kinda fun! Too easy, though."

Excited chatter sprouted from the crowd. You could only make out fragments here and there.

"Did you see that laser?"

"I was just standing there, and then a zap, and then these people dressed like comic book characters suddenly-"

"-Grew her soooo big! Wasn't it Mordred who was supposed to be the one who-"

"-like that episode where GL met the Justice Guild! 'Legends'. So the amulet brought us from another universe."

"Wonder Woman's carrying the rest of the team, just like the movies."

"Come on, a world without grownups? It'd be awesome to-"

"-Hypercrisis, man! Grant Morrison is behind this! The absolute madman, he killed the Fabulous Killjoys, and now we're next!"

"-It's so meta, even this acronym -"

A shape emerged from the shadow of Diana's hair. A little kid, cloaked in a cowl. Batman looked over her, his mask's eye holes somehow widening. "Where's the amulet?"

Diana lifted her empty hand. "Right here!... wait." The realization struck her like a punch to the time-space continuum. Her smug smile shrunk to a confused "o" shape. She leaned over crowd, looking across the square. Under her scrutinizing gaze - like a Greek deity passing judgement - they hushed to a gentle whisper.

You felt a slight pressure in your side. Something cold hit you. A bystander in a large jacket shoved you while walking, accompanied by a mumble: "filthy peasant...". You grabbed at him - only for his coat to slide off. It hid was the amulet; held in the sleeve of a fancy purple outfit; accompanied by cool poofy hat; and a punchable face.

"Hey! It's Mordred!" You yelled up.

"Gah! You fool!" The self-named king started shaking the stone and chanting a spell. Nothing happened. Apparently, the magic artifact needed some recharge time.

In that brief second of fumbling, Wonder Woman was already reaching down. With a skillful leap, Mordred dodged her mighty grasp. The same couldn't be said for you and a handful of other kids. You felt squeezed against the segments, into the small wrinkles between the phalanges, and against fellow bystanders. When she uncurled her fist and scanned you all, a blush crossed her looming face.

"That way!" Clark flew after the purple blur, followed closely by John and Bruce. With no time to lose, Diana simply kept you all in her palm as she went after them.

The young king slipped into a hut. The heroes instantly assaulted it with a mix of laser eyes, a green cannon blast, and batarangs. All were deflected back at off the hut's walls. They were flying directly for Batman!

Diana dove out in front of the projectiles, arms stretched - her wrist-guards shielding the cloaked terror. It took her a second to notice that she'd clenched her fingers, squeezing you again - and that her guarding move had also compressed the rest of the child-sized Batman tightly into her chest.

You and the crowd came down safely - but the by in her arms stayed there for a second. She giggled, despite herself. "I never many dolls back on Themyscira. You know... You're really soft."

Batman struggled, kicking around. "Stop hugging me! I'm not a toy!" His face turned red, but it was hard to tell if it was from pressure or embarrassment. "I-I am the night! I am vengeance!"

Green Lantern turned back to the castle, groaning. "Look, you two can play mommy and daddy AFTER we've saved the world."

You could hear Mordred laughing, even behind the sturdy walls. "I'm still the greatest magician on the planet! Reflection spells are child's play - so to speak. And soon, I'll have the amulet's powers once more!"

Getting back up, the young Wonder Woman kicked through the hut. The whole west wall groaned at the tip of her boot. It flew a huge distance away, a testament to the strength in her lithe-but-gigantic legs.

Superman gazed into the distance, impressed. "Well, guess I'll have to fly over for -"

"Haha! Missed!"

The boy was now standing atop a tower. Teleportation magic! Wondy swung at it, knocking the building in two pieces. The crowd below fled again, being careful this time to ensure you were with them as the rubble hit the ground.

The taunting voice came from another house. "In here, big shot!"

She dashed over to it, crushing the structure easily under her boot. "You can't run forever!" She ground the heel down, ensuring he couldn't re-use the hideout.

"I know. I just need to run for another few minutes, and then..."

His laughter was cut off by another stomp - but he teleported to safety once more.

Green Lantern groaned. "Is she going to have to tear the whole town apart to get us back to normal?"

Batman started plotting, drawing shapes in the ground. "Quiet. I can't think of a plan with -"

STOMP

"Come out!" Diana shouted, destroying another structure.
123213.title: Giant Diana and Mordred's Curse

1232132.content:
Smash!

A medieval tavern turned to rubble beneath Wonder Woman's crushing leg power. Sugary drinks exploded from the splintering wood, seeping into the ground below, and staining the towering crimson boot.

Mordred teleported away. He floated behind her shoulders, blowing a raspberry. "Nah-nah!" Diana's eyes narrowed. She twisted, and clapped her immense palms at him. In a flash of green, the young king vanished once more.

"Over there!" Clark pointed to a small hut, decorated with menacing spikes. Indeed, the magician's grinning face was in the window. The titan lept forward, lifting her leg from the dust - rubble tumbling from it - and stomped the roof. The jagged edge of the spike pierced her sole. She stumbled backwards in pain, her star-spangled tights slamming into the earth. The impact generated a massive earthquake. It sent you, the other dimensionally-displaced kids, and the pint-sized Leaguers bouncing in the air. She groaned, rubbing her leg.

Mordred's laughter echoed again. "Pretty big butt for such a baby!"

"Only because of your stupid stone!" The titanic girl tore out her Lasso of Truth, and expertly twisted it at a set of buildings. Despite her delicate frame, she was nevertheless an Amazon; she pulled swiftly, and tore the structures from their foundations. They collapsed into her sturdy torso, wooden splinters falling across her underwear and chest.

But once again, Mordred had vanished.

Young Diana leaned onto her shoulder, peering over Bruce's sketches in the ground. "I don't have time to crush EVERY hiding place. Any plans?"

"We can throw buildings at him..." The cowled hero slashed his dark glove against his sketches. "... No, that's stupid, he'll just zap away! Urgh, his powers aren't fair!"

Green Lantern tapped his ring. "I'll make a fake amulet to distract him! But wait, that rock's purple..." John lifted his finger up. "I'll fool him by making a fake giant Wonder Woman! But wait, that'll make him teleport more! We need to think like a hide-and-seek expert..."

Diana groaned, the landscape shifting as she brushed her black hair. "Easy enough. Bruce's been hiding for years now."

Bruce slammed a fist into his drawing. "Shut up! I can't think with all this talking!" He sketched in the sand furiously. "How can we hide when she's so big, and we have these noisy kids to keep out of the way?"

The crowd murmured, looking down, ashamed. They shuffled their feet. Some of the smaller ones cried gently.

Clark, scanning them, thought. "Hm. What if we didn't have to keep them aside?" His cape fluttered. "Is there any way you could use these guys?"

The heroine shook her head. "He probably wouldn't trust them."

The darknight detective looked over their worried faces. "No way. It's not right to force kids without superpowers into our fight. Someone could get hurt."

John patted his shoulder. "Uh, Bruce? How many Robins and Batgirls have you had, exactly?"

For a second, the young Batman bore something that almost resembled a smile. "Okay, I thought of something." He turned to the crowd of diminished travelers. "But you guys better stay in line!"

A chorus of voices emerged from the crowd, with nods and salutes:

"Roger, sir Batboy!"

"I've always wanted to save the day!"

"Do I get a go at the ring?"

"Just let me punch that Mordred guy!"

"Ooh, Batman with preptime, this is good."

"Grant Morrison, please grant us this victory."

---

The hut's table, surprisingly, had enough space for you underneath it; reminding you how much smaller you were as a kid. And Diana's continual stomping outside didn't help. The glimpses of red and blue through the window worried you. Even if you knew she had your best interests in mind, Wonder Woman was awfully temperamental earlier...

...No, you had to stick with the plan. You remained hidden. As Batman said, someone who's good at hiding makes a good seeker.

While the League chased the sorcerer, the rest of you had gotten to work. The pieces were in place - more or less. You hoped everyone else was ready...

In a flash, Mordred appeared in the house beside yours. Clark floated nearby, watching. The blond sneered at him, arms crossed. "What's wrong? Are you finally bowing to your King?"

From within a cupboard, a pair of girls jumped at Mordred, seizing his cloak. His eyes bulged in shock, then rage. "Hey - remove your grubby hands!"

The boy teleported, leaving them holding nothing. But at the next place he appeared, a boy hiding under a bed held him by the legs. Mordred kicked helplessly. "Filthy - after everything your king's done for you!"

He disappeared again - and again. Each time, the wizard child was beset by the grasp of hidden children, beating him at his own game. The plan was working so far.

Suddenly, a shockwave shook the pots and pans above you. Mordred's tights were right in front of you. This was your chance. He brushed his shoulders, grumbling: "I've had enough of this game..."

You lunged up. He stumbled in surprise, falling to his stuffed buttocks. You grabbed for his necklace - the one that held the Amulet of First Magic to his chest. He wrestled against you. "You're cheating! This isn't fair!"

The gem reflected candlelight off the table, and into dark clouds. Briefly freeing your hands, you made shadows with them - a Bat-signal, then a "W".

Unfortunately, this gave the magician in mauve the upper hand. He punched a solid blow to your cheek. Pain surged through it. Mordred clenched his teeth together, and clutched the gem. "At last! It's recharged. And I know the brat I'm going to start with..."

He conjured a gigantic axe. With a wave of his fingers, you floated in midair, upside-down. He aimed the weapon for your neck...

...And stumbled, dropping the amulet.

The ground shook. Both you and the villain lifted into the air, as if the hut were an elevator rushing to the fifty-second floor. The chairs slid back and forth Bits of floor and wall crumbled, torn from their foundations. Outside the window, you passed by a pair of blue shorts; followed by a red top with a small bulge; a lean neck framed by raven hair; and finally, a girl's face with blue eyes and a coy smile. Diana was lifting the house up with her bare hands! With a small breath to prepare, the gigantic girl pulled the walls from either end, ripping the building apart like cardboard. Mordred, the gemstone, and you, all landed in her hand, cushioned by its softness.

A smile crossed the titanic lips before you. "Thanks for the help, little guy! We knew Mordred's pride would get the better of him!"

You nodded to her, beaming. But soon, something cold fell on your neck. The wizard held his axe - and was holding it to you, twitching. She yelped.

"I'm still king here!" He shouted. "Drop me, you big dummy, or I'll execute this child!"

Your shoulders felt weak. Diana winced. "That's dirty!" So close to victory! Her shivers transferred over your body. You readied yourself to take the blow, and sacrifice your life for the other travelers...

...When Wonder Woman winced harder.

And started laughing, shaking your unsteady platform.

"What?" The magician snarled, ready to strike.

That small lump within the girl's top bulged. It wiggled, and clawed its way to the neckline.

From within Wondy's outfit, the toddler-ized Etrigan emerged - and grabbed the Amulet of First Magic, cooing with glee.

Mordred's axe crumbled to bits. The storm clouds gave way to blue. "No! No, traitor! I am your - Arrrgh!"

His screaming continued as Diana plucked him up, and stuffed him into her chest. "There we are, nice and comfy." She smiled to you, placing you and the demon down safely on a great castle's wall - as it shifted into a theme park's decoration, like they were before.

Clark flew in, giving high-fives to the kids who helped - and headpats to those shaking from the battle. "That's a job well done, you three! Giganta could learn a lesson from you!"

She shrugged. "Hey, heroes come in every size, don't they?" She gave your head a brief stroke, feeling its texture and touching her lip. "And besides, we had a little mastermind behind it! Thanks for the cute necklace, Bruce!"

"Wh-whatever!" Bruce did his best to hide in the shadows of amusement park rides, beset by crowds of cooing admirers and shippers pushing him. "Just bring us to normal with that jewel!"

John approached, grabbing the Amulet of First Magic. "Not yet - we gotta send everyone back to their own universe."

Amid a fluffy of groans and sighs, everyone watched as the jewel shone brighter, and brighter. Everyone waved goodbyes. The last thing you remember is seeing Diana saluting you, as she slowly returned to normal size, and her adult proportions...

...

...And, exactly like how you came in, you were sitting before a screen. Credits in washed-out colors flashed across it. You rubbed your temples, dizzy from the travel. Out the window, stars shone. Your cheek had a bruise By your feet lay action figures you're pretty sure you'd never bought - with Wonder Woman's figure larger than the others.

She never had a chance to play much with dolls. Hopefully, someone would be able to play with these...

You scratched your head briefly. Was that adventure merely... your imagination?

"Yes, but isn't imagination all we are?" A voice asked. "With the right spark, any fiction can become a living, breathing thing."

The voice came from your closet. You opened the door, and blinked.

Grant Morrison blinked back.

It was a normal summer day on the west coast city, the day was hot and most of the summer and heat like this would people mostly be on the beach or on a theme park, however...outside the outskirts of the city a strange figure was coming towards the city.

Meanwhile back at the city, the citizens of the coastal city were doing their daily routines when suddenly, they felt a small tremor and another one and another one till the tremors seem to come closer than closer till they could feel the ground shaking, All of a sudden people from across the streets were running away till you see a giant foot the size of a fully equipped SUV peeking behind the building, you slowly look up and you see that is a giant young girl around ten or eleven with long brown braids,a rather cute yet freckled face and brown eyes but not just any girl, for some reason she looked very familiar to you.

When she stepped from behind the building you could see her wearing nothing but her underwear and judging from your point of view she had to be around 70 feet tall the closest skyscraper barely reached her head itself and below her enormous feet people were running and screaming,others were utterly curious and taking pictures of her with their cellphones however being that she nearly reached the clouds themselves it was hard to make out her facial expression though if you had to make a wild guess she probably would have been smiling

However you really grew scared when the girl spoke for the first time.

Laura: Ohh where am I at? What.... what are these strange structures these people have build, I have never seen glass shiny buildings like these before in all my life I wonder where am I....." Her very voice sent small tremors echoing alongside the ground people screamed and covered their ears

That's when you remember who she was, She was Laura Ingalls, from the 1970s tv show Little House on the Prairie.

But what happened to her and how she get so big?

131122.content:
You watched as Laura dragged her hand along the side of one of the skyscrapers, sending a wave of debris falling to the ground, along with a few people who hit the ground with bone shattering force. "Oh my, I must be dreaming, or else glass would have hurt," the massive girl smiled. "And if this is truly a dream then I have no need to fear the consequences of my actions!" As she crouched down the crowds ran even faster, fearing what the huge girl could do.

You took off down an ally, hoping to escape notice on your own. Sheltering behind a stack of crates, you watched the underwear clad giantess step over the running people and looking over her shoulder. "Perhaps I can see what these tiny sprites feel like underneath me," she said as she braced herself against two buildings and lowered her rear end to the ground. Over a hundred people were caught beneath her descending ass and reduced to gory pancakes. The sound alone caused you to vomit, and you heard Laura giggle. "Oh, it feels warm," she said. Rising to a crouch, you couldn't help but look at her almost nonexistent blood strained underwear she must have reduced the tiny crowds to dust rather than goo explaining why there was hardy any amounts of splattered bodies on her rear end. Then an even more horrifying thing happened, her eyes came to rest on you. "Oh, a little one is watching me," she said as her huge hand reached out for you.

You tried to run, but she easily reached you, a hand the size of a car wrapping around you and lifting you dozens of feet into the air. "Hello there tiny one, can you tell me the name of this dream city I am currently in? Perhaps you are a piece of my mind in this dream world with me?" You were far too scared to speak, and Laura frowned at your silence. "Hmph, perhaps I was wrong to pick you up and hold you like this. No matter, I shall explore my dream without your aid." Keeping you in her hand, Laura stood up, seemingly growing a few feet taller as she did so and causing her clothing to tighten on her body.

A roar came from her stomach, and Laura placed a hand on her belly. "Oh dear, it seems my digestion has caught up with me." Spying a building where many of her dream sprites were sheltering, the giantess stomped over and crouched down over the roof of the grocery store. "Some sort of marketplace?" She wondered, seeing the billboards of fruit and cereal. "Not for much longer," she giggled. Placing you carelessly on a rooftop you nearly fell from, you watched her pull the roof off and move her undergarments over the hole. "A little gift from me," she laughed as she let loose a monstrous explosion of gas from within herself. The fart filled the store in an instant, sending countless items and shoppers flying out into the open air. Windows shattered, and even the walls bulged out under the force of the released gas.

"Oh my! That was impressive, even by the standards of a dream," Laura smiled. She felt her remaining clothing grow tighter on her once more. "Am I gaining even greater height?! I love this dream," she exclaimed. "Whatever shall I do next?" She wondered.

While young 10 years old Laura Ingalls looks around trying to figure out what she could do next in her dream. She sees a big building almost up to her waist, deciding that Laura will have some fun with the building next. And also any little people she can find in there.

As Laura starts walking towards the office building her foot steps creating panic in the streets as hundreds of screaming,running humans ran between her toes everyone inside looking fearfully out of nearly 20 story tall building knew that they would be soon be the giant little girl from the 1880s' playthings. While some tried to run away and hide, some just decided to wait and see what happens. Laura with a small smile upon her face suddenly got so close to the building that all they could see was her massive waist and her rather chunky thighs. Laura then got on her knees so she could see the people inside.

As she looked inside and saw people hiding behind desks and running down stairs, Half-Pint couldn't help but let out a earth-shaking giggle "Don't worry I'm not going to hurt any of you." She whispered as she continued to slowly look around noticing all the strange shiny modern era devices and objects then back at the tiny people cowering in their cubicles or running around she doesn't care about them. She wants to play with the ones that are just standing there. Not being so rude. Laura wants them to get closer so she slid down so the people inside the window couldn't see. The people standing there was confused as where the young giantess went. They walked closer to the office window and looked for Laura.

"BOOOO! GIGGLE!! GOT YOU!" Laura said as she got on her knees again and suddenly popped up out of nowhere with her hands up in a childish scary motion and scared the living daylights out of the people some falling over or clutching their chests or even ears for protection as the mere sound of her voice was louder than ten jumbo jets combined Laura laughed at them, now that she can get a closer look, she sees that they all seem to be very attractive like little dolls she can pick up and cuddle and although part of her wanted to do that. Laura instead made a kissy face to all the little people in front of her. She then puckered up her small pinkish lips and brought her lips closer to the window and kissed it. Leaving a huge wad of saliva kiss mark.

All of a sudden Laura's stomach rumbles shaking a few department store windows and she looks down at it and puts one hand over it and she is surprised. "Ohhh.....I didn't think I could get hungry in a dream." Regardless she thinks about what she can eat.

What does she eat? Does she do the unthinkable and eat the tiny people. Or does she eat all the hotdog shaped vendors?

131122222.content:
The burp disappeared as everyone around her stopped running all covering their ears in agony. That was by far the most loudest and destructive burp in history. As young ten year old Laura Ingalls aka Half-Pint looked partly ashamed at first, but she eventually did accept that it wasn't that bad. She's simply playfully rampaging through the town, who cares what they all think. She could run naked through the city and no one could do anything about it.

“Ohh, that was a loud one. I don't usually burp. I'm a lot more polite than that." Laura said to no one in particular. She just spoke out knowing that the small people could hear every word. “But you know, I'm having so much fun so you can't really be angry at me."

Laura laughed for a while more,every bit of her annoying wild laughter causing more mild tremors for the tiny unnamed city and it's inhabitants below and literally scaring the shit of out everyone in the area. Who knew that such a nice little girl from the late 19th Century could let out a monstrous laugh and be so damn destructive? Laura however stopped,suddenly clutching her stomach area as she felt another burp coming up. Smiling to herself she quickly looked around. Scooting around planning to grab something before she started burping loudly again feeling that not all the limitless gallons of soda had not fully digested inside her tummy. After a few more steps she spotted a fancy businessman screaming his head off while trying to hide under some rubble.

Laura wanted to taunt him, but she didn't have time. Reaching down she grabbed him between her fingers before he could run. Her two fingers pinning his legs. Twisting him upside down as she hung him right at her mouth. He just kept screaming as Laura opened her mouth.

"No...no pl...please let me go!!" He pleaded fearfully.

"Giggle! You're all just so cute...I could just eat you up or else keep you all as my little doll collection but I have something else in...uh oh I feel another burp coming on........" Half-Pint groaned clutching her stomach with her free hand.

Then right to his face, Laura burped a massive breath. Not only being somehow louder then before, but pretty much destroying the man dangling from her massive tree trunk sized fingers as he looked really funny the way his hair was whipping around within the high wind and he mostly resembled a cartoon character the way he was constantly screaming but paying no mind Laura continued this burp for about five seconds. Once she was done she wiped her mouth to get the left over saliva off. She looked at the man she plucked and burped at. He looked pretty dead, not to mention completely covered with her saliva. After laughing at the sight she merely tossed the man to the side. Why would she want to play with a broken toy?

She feels another coming up. Looking around she looks for her new toy. Spoting a young teenage blond girl scared out of her wits near by she smiled. This young chick looked like the typical city folk she often heard about from the simple country folk back home with all those fancy clothes, high heels, thick makeup and of course running around like a prissy.

"Pa and Ma always said those certain high rising city folk were weird,the way they lord over everyone else! Maybe I can even out the odds!" Laura said as she rubbed her hands together.

The blonde girl screamed once she saw the gigantic little girl coming for her and took off like a bullet but unfortunately didn't get far, with her fingers coming for her, she got lifted off the ground. Up to her face the blonde screamed at the little country girl’s gigantic face. She tries to wiggle her way out, she couldn't move anyway at all.

"Ahhhhhhhh please...please Miss Giant...l-let me go!" The tiny girl began openly crying and pleading for her life. But Half-Pint giggled loudly causing another earth quake shaking her head enjoying this wild dream where she was far larger than anything on Earth more and more.

“Oh you mean ole little prissy girl you all think you're better than us simple folks from the country.....you're gonna hate this!” Laura said with a innocent smile.

"Which will make me really happy!” The girl kept screaming, however Laura didn't care anymore. Her stomach rumbled as she felt another one coming up.

"Buuuuurrrrrrrrrrrrppppppp!!" Once more the ground shook and even more car alarms went off and windows exploded with a big smile she let her burp come up and hit the girl, not as much as it hit the man but still pretty hard. During her loudest belch the girl didn't stop screaming. It actually being much louder than even she expected.

Laura finished and saw the girl still hanging there, still alive and beyond terrified. Good thing she didn't try to burp her to death like she did the businessman. “Ohh my, you're pretty sturdy aren't you? I'd thought all you uptown girls would break easier than babies would.”

“Please, let me go! Let me go you brat!” The girl yelled in complete fear. Laura frowned at the tiny teen's rude comment, which sealed her fate.

“You're very rude you know that? Just like my old rival Nellie back home! All I want to do is play around with you all! So you want me to let you go, fine. I'll let you go _____________”

1352322222222222222222111.content:
The story of how you got in this position was all a blur. You knew some details, but at this point you're not in the mood to go on about boring details. You're fine with the summary "One minute you were normal, now you're about 2 or 3 inches tall and clinging onto the top of a sky blue slipper for dear life as its owner, a rather energetic and peppy blonde haired girl, ran down the street from her school. You almost lost your grip several times, but fate seemed to smile at you as the young titan would always stop for whatever reason right before your arms would give out. Disputes the dangers of this position, you sure as hell didn't want to let go and risk getting stepped on or run over. At the very least, you wanted to reach this girl's place then try to get someone's attention where you'll have fewer things to worry about.

Thankfully this relief came sooner than you thought as the girl suddenly opened the door to a building and ran to her room. Kicking off her slippers by her bed, The young giant entered an adjascent bathroom, not bothering to close the door all the way since t was connected to her own room which was already locked. You took this opportunity to finally let go and catch your breath after that ordeal getting here.as you rested, steam started to seep out from the bathroom. Clearly she was taking a bath or shower. Maybe it's best if you wait for her to finish up before getting her attention. Then again, perhaps it will be easier to get her attention if she's taking a bath. She might not mistake you for some sort of pervert if you immediately let her know about your presence as well.

By the time you opened your eyes, you saw a lot of red around you. You almost thought they were trees or grass, but nothing about them smelled natural. In fact, they smelled clean...and were quite soft. Looking around more, you see a giant stool, dresser, and bed.

"Is this...is this a giant bedroom?"

That's what you thought, until from a distance you saw, on the makeup table, a framed picture of a blonde girl with pretty eyes and good posture, someone you know you recognize. Which meant...

"No... This isn't a giant room... Somehow... I've been shrunk..."

Yes it was true. You were roughly the side of a Lilliputian, minus the round heads, and you just heard the echo of the door creak. You turned and saw the blonde girl from the photo, wearing her purple sweatshirt, dark leggings and uggs. You recognized her now as Pacifica Northwest, the wealthy Northwest heiress. She started walking normally towards you and in fact almost stomped on you when you yelled as loud as you could.

Although your tells only sounded like a mouse squeaking to Pacifica, it still got her attention.

"Is that...a tiny person?" she asked, looking down at you.
1352322222222222222222221221.title: Pacifica Northwest

The giant blonde looking down at you suddenly grinned widely and mischievously, sending the feeling of dread through the pit of your stomach.

"Finally," her voice boomed, "A new plaything at my disposal!

"Wait, what?" you screamed, "I am NOT your plaything! I'm an actual human being! I don't..."

You didn't even get to finish your sentence as Pacifica grabbed you with just two of her giant fingers as she lifted you up towards her face. You could clearly see how much eye shadow she had on, as well as the gloss of her lipstick and perfectly smooth skin.

"Can't let you do that, slave," she said.

"Slave?! I will NOT be a slave to some..."

"No, no, no," Pacifica said, booping you on the nose with her much larger fingertip, "You don't get to decide whether or not you get to be my slave! You don't get to make the choice of what I do with you. And trust me, you will love where I put you...or else!"
